qas.question: Which group of people were now considered to be politically equal with the plebeians?
Which group of people rebelled by vacating Rome?
How many plebeian families had an identical standing as the old aristocratic patrician families?
What did the rebelling plebeians want before they returned to Rome?

context: The plebeians had finally achieved political equality with the <a0_0>patricians<a0_0/>. However, the plight of the average plebeian had not changed. <a2_0>A small number<a2_0/> of plebeian families achieved the same standing that the old aristocratic patrician families had always had, but the new plebeian aristocrats became as uninterested in the plight of the average plebeian as the old patrician aristocrats had always been. <a1_0>The plebeians<a1_0/> rebelled by leaving Rome and refusing to return until they had <a3_0>more rights<a3_0/>. The patricians then noticed how much they needed the plebeians and accepted their terms. The plebeians then returned to Rome and continued their work.
